title: Relief for Barclays as 'knockout' investment bank overshadows £1.4bn PPI hit
text:
Barclays' prized investment bank beat Wall Street rivals in the three months to September, boosting chief executive Jes Staley as he fights off demands for a shake-up from corporate raider Ed Bramson.

The bank stayed in profit despite being hit by a £1.4bn bill for compensating customers caught up in the payment protection insurance (PPI) mis-selling scandal, beating the expectations of analysts.

Its investment bank posted a particularly strong set of numbers, with revenue growth of 17pc compared to the around 10pc average of its US competitors.
